description._content: Image taken from: Title: "The History of Ireland, from the earliest period to the year 1245, when the Annals of Boyle, which are adopted and embodied as the running text authority, terminate: with a brief essay on the native annalists, and other sources for illustrating Ireland, and full statistical and historical notices of the Barony of Boyle. [With a “Catalogue of the manuscript indexes and compilations of John D'Alton, etc.”]" Author: D'ALTON, John - Barrister-at-Law Shelfmark: "British Library HMNTS 809.k.3." Volume: 01 Page: 243 Place of Publishing: Dublin Date of Publishing: 1845 Publisher: The Author Issuance: monographic Identifier: 000855782 Note: The colours, contrast and appearance of these illustrations are unlikely to be true to life. They are derived from scanned images that have been enhanced for machine interpretation and have been altered from their originals.
